intro: Thesium confusum, commonly known as the confused thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and spike-like inflorescence. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered at the tips of its stems. Thesium confusum thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
